newsitem.title: USA: US West Coast unleaded gasoline eases in Bay Area.
newsitem.headline: US West Coast unleaded gasoline eases in Bay Area.

text.p: U.S. West Coast spot unleaded gasoline and diesel fuel prices eased in San Francisco on weak demand as floodwaters began to recede in some areas of central and northern California, traders said Tuesday.
With vast areas of farmland and hundreds of homes still under water in northern and central California from recent rains, spot demand for refined products remained weak.
"Demand in the Bay Area is dead," one trader said.

The weaker demand was reflected in American Petroleum Institite's weekly stocks report, which pegged PADD V West Coast gasoline stocks up 705,000 barrels and distillates up 177,000 barrels on the week.
Unleaded gasoline was bid 76 cents a gallon in San Francisco, two cents below bids in Los Angeles, traders said. Premium in both markets moved to seven cents over regular unleaded.

Earlier in the day, sellers refused to come off prices pushed higher by yesterday's futures rally, and buyers that fled to the sidelines during the run-up patiently waited for cash prices to ease, traders said.
"Sellers are not coming down, and buyers are looking for lower prices in line with the Merc," one trader said.
